image.altText: A prototype of a lunar rover, with big black wheels, a gold body and a panel on the side.

props.synopsis: An Australian-made rover called Roo-ver will be part of an upcoming NASA mission to the Moon to help extract oxygen and metals from lunar soil.

title.children: Could this prototype become Australia's first Moon rover?

image.altText: Black-and-white picture of Ben Aulich.

props.synopsis: Former Canberra criminal lawyer Ben Aulich will stand trial after allegedly talking with an undercover police officer about setting up a supermarket to launder money from illegal cigarette sales.

title.children: Former Canberra lawyer to stand trial for allegedly conspiring to launder money

image.altText: A sitting dog looks up at the camera.

props.synopsis: Oakley, the six-year-old border collie, is a conservation detection dog who sniffs out noxious alligator weed in Canberra's Lake Burley Griffin.

title.children: Conservation detection dog Oakley having a ball patrolling Lake Burley Griffin for invasive weed

image.altText: Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory

props.synopsis: The 38-year-old man was charged with two counts of sexual assault after a picnic with the alleged victim at a secluded spot at the Cotter Reserve just outside Canberra in 2020.

title.children: Jury fails to reach verdict in trial of former PhD student who allegedly 'love-bombed' and raped woman

image.altText: A copy of Mem Fox's book Where is the Green Sheep? stands alongside copies of its commemorative coin.

props.synopsis: Classic children's book written by Mem Fox and illustrated by Judy Horacek gets commemorated on 20-cent coin.

title.children: Where is the green sheep? On a 20-cent coin

image.altText: A male choir rehearses. There are two lines of men, with one line standing on a stop behind the others.

props.synopsis: The Canberra Men's Choir is an "awesome fellowship" and no auditions are required.

title.children: Retirement can be a 'trap' for men. So these blokes joined a choir

image.altText: Four people in formal clothes walking on street

props.synopsis: The brother of Senator Linda Reynolds tells a court it was difficult finding his sister very unwell and "rolled up in a ball" on a couch over allegations about how she treated Brittany Higgins.

title.children: Former defence minister found 'rolled up in a ball' on couch over Brittany Higgins allegations, court told

image.altText: a woman smiles with her horse

props.synopsis: Tributes are flowing for Michelle O'Neill who died after a horse kicked her in the head in the NSW Snowy Monaro.

title.children: Respected trainer described as 'one of the greats' dies in shock horse accident

image.altText: HIMARS rocket launch

props.synopsis: The US will remove critical export and arms regulations in order to encourage trade of weapons and military technology between the three AUKUS partners.

title.children: Weapons export rules removed for trade between Australia and AUKUS partners

image.altText: High shot of red pants, with a pad on them. In bathroom.

props.synopsis: Women with disabilities are worried they could lose access to essential period care as the NDIS transitions to new rules.

title.children: Fracturing a finger putting in a tampon: Should period care be covered by the NDIS?

image.altText: New Zealand's prime minister Christopher Luxon listens while Anthony Albanese (out of focus in the foreground) speaks.

props.synopsis: New Zealand's Prime Minister Christopher Luxon has vowed to press Anthony Albanese over Australia's criminal deportations policy when the two leaders sit down for official talks later today in Canberra.

title.children: NZ prime minister vows to press Anthony Albanese on criminal deportations

image.altText: Man and woman standing behind a cart full of food and household items

props.synopsis: The media — and the internet in particular — are full of eye-catching bravado about the economy and what recent data is telling us about the future. But what happens when things are far from certain?

title.children: Why is the RBA deputy talking about gurus, charlatans and buffoons? It's the hidden danger in our economic debate

image.altText: A woman wearing a green and gold tracksuit holds her hands like a kangaroo on a purple stage with judges behind her

props.synopsis: Australian Olympic breakdancer Rachael Gunn has asked for the "hate" towards her family and friends to stop in the aftermath of a media furore over her performance in Paris.

title.children: Breaker Raygun calls for end to 'pretty devastating' Olympics reaction

image.altText: Men carry a blue body bag on a stretcher

props.synopsis: The Palestinian Ministry of Health says a total 40,005 people have been killed and 92,401 injured since October 7, when Hamas-led militants attacked southern Israel, killing some 1,200 people — most of them civilians — and took roughly 250 hostages to Gaza, according to Israeli tallies.

title.children: Death toll in Gaza surpasses 40,000, Palestinian health officials say

image.altText: Picture of a smart meter in the meter box

props.synopsis: Like millions of Australians, Doreen Fawcett is grappling with a nightmare of unwanted power bill complexity. Calls for simplification are growing.

title.children: Perplexing, punishing power prices force industry to concede 'smart' meter overhaul not so clever

image.altText: Zali Steggall speaks in the House of Representatives surrounded by Labor women

props.synopsis: The OG teal independent has always had an ability to get under the skin of the blokes in the Coalition, but Thursday seemed different, with Steggall at times having to shout to get over the wall of words.

title.children: As Dutton joined the hecklers, a moment of kindness stopped business as usual in Parliament

image.altText: Richard Shields walking on a metropolitan street

props.synopsis: The state executive of the NSW Liberal Party has terminated the employment of its state director Richard Shields after dozens of Liberal-endorsed candidates were failed to be nominated for upcoming local elections.

title.children: NSW Liberal Party director sacked over local election paperwork blunder

image.altText: A woman in a sparkling leotard sings and looks on.

props.synopsis: Pop megastar Taylor Swift returns to the stage in London for her first public performances since three shows in Vienna were cancelled after authorities uncovered a terrorist plot to "kill as many people as possible" at them.

title.children: 'I'm not worried at all': Taylor Swift returns to stage after foiled terror plot saw shows cancelled

image.altText: An Aboriginal woman stares straight at the camera in a black shirt with curly brown hair

props.synopsis: A two-year inquiry has recommended widespread reform of police practices when responding to First Nations missing and murdered cases.

title.children: First Nations families denied justice, landmark inquiry into murdered and missing women finds

image.altText: A composite of Latrell Mitchell, Leigh Sales and Ariarne Titmus

props.synopsis: It's time to test your knowledge about the news of the week.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: Which state won the Olympics, Latrell Mitchell's bad day, and the end of another Australian festival

image.altText: A close up of a smiling Matthew Perry, wearing clear plastic-rimmed glasses, a black suit jacked and a grey v-neck shirt.

props.synopsis: The Friends actor was found face down in his hot tub in Los Angeles last year. An autopsy found large amounts of the drug ketamine in his blood.

title.children: Matthew Perry's personal assistant among five people charged after actor's death

image.altText: The arms and torso of a patient with skin lesions

props.synopsis: Swedish health officials say the person was infected while in Africa with the clade Ib type of mpox involved in the recent outbreak.

title.children: First case of mpox confirmed outside of Africa in Sweden

image.altText: A close up of a woman looking out a window.

props.synopsis: Peter Dutton's call for a temporary ban on accepting Palestinian refugees from Gaza has fuelled government accusations he is dividing the community.

title.children: Independent MP who fled war says debate over Gaza refugee ban is 'triggering', as Peter Dutton doubles down

image.altText: A Rex Airlines plane stands on a runway.

props.synopsis: The federal government will guarantee all regional flight bookings for customers of Rex during its administration process over the next month.

title.children: Federal government guarantees regional flights for Rex customers during administration

image.altText: Latrell Mitchell looks to one side

props.synopsis: Rabbitohs star Latrell Mitchell will have five business days to respond to a breach notice from the NRL following the integrity unit's investigation into a photograph of him which circulated on social media this week.

title.children: Latrell Mitchell handed breach notice by NRL over photograph featuring white substance

image.altText: The musician Peaches, singing into a mic on a stage, mouth wide open, bathed in pink light

props.synopsis: The punk provocateur reflects on the legacy of her breakthrough album, The Teaches of Peaches, as a documentary about the album and the artist is released.

title.children: How the 'shy and awkward' Merrill Nisker became the bold and profane Peaches

image.altText: A close up image of a woman with brown hair with her two thumbs up.

props.synopsis: It follows the country's constitutional court this week dismissing the prime minister, who had only been in power for less than a year.

title.children: Daughter of former billionaire Thai PM could be country's next leader

image.altText: A wide shot of the Train's home, with two sheds and a dam in sight.

props.synopsis: A woman close with Nathaniel, who made the missing persons report after not seeing him in person for 12 months, gives evidence at the Wieambilla shooting inquest.

title.children: Wieambilla inquest hears haunting final message to woman who reported Nathaniel Train missing

image.altText: Nathan Cleary. favouring his left shoulder, walks off the field

props.synopsis: Penrith's push for a fourth consecutive NRL premiership has been rocked after star halfback Nathan Cleary injured his left shoulder in the 24-22 loss to fellow heavyweights Melbourne.

title.children: Penrith sweating on Cleary fitness after star halfback leaves field in Panthers' 24-22 loss to Melbourne

image.altText: A black and white photo of Glen Malcolm Conning in the cockpit of a helicopter on the ground.

props.synopsis: Family and friends of the New Zealand pilot shot dead in West Papua last week gather in his home town for a private funeral. He was remembered as a man with the Maori value of "mana".

title.children: NZ pilot shot dead in West Papua remembered by family and friends as a man with 'mana'

image.altText: Megaupload founder Kim Dotcom

props.synopsis: The self-described "internet freedom fighter" has been fighting extradition to the United States since 2012 following an FBI-ordered raid on his Auckland mansion.

title.children: Internet mogul Kim Dotcom to be extradited to the US, NZ justice minister says

image.altText: Women hold candles and chant at a protest in Kolkata, India.

props.synopsis: Thousands of women march across several Indian cities as outrage and protests against the gruesome rape and murder of a doctor escalate.

title.children: Thousands of women protest rape of trainee doctor in India

image.altText: Star trails over land and water

props.synopsis: Sink into your chair and prepare your brain for a battle with knowledge. With questions ranging from the Moon to Sirius and celestial gems outside our galaxy, this quiz will stretch the boundaries of your mind.

title.children: Think you're pretty night-sky-smart? Take our star-crossed quiz to find out
